conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a cutaway/isometric 3D interior: walls have clear height and thickness, multiple wall faces are visible, and rooms read as volumetric spaces with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clean corners and visible wall thickness; elevated angled view; ceiling removed consistently. Minor simplifications in wall-top detailing but overall solid cutaway.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match well (left bedroom, central bath, small adjacent room, right bedroom, living room, kitchen/dining). Proportions and main wall runs are close, though a few opening positions/sizes and some partition lengths appear slightly adjusted relative to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present: beds, desks, sofa/TV area, dining table, kitchen counters, and bathroom fixtures. Minor discrepancies in exact furniture count/placement compared to the 2D symbols (e.g., left bedroom bed arrangement and some cabinetry/wardrobe placement).

visual_clarity.notes: Readable walls/floors/openings with consistent materials and good visibility. Lighting is even and does not hide geometry; no obvious mesh breaks. Presentation is clean with neutral background.

detected_errors.description: Some door/window placements and/or opening proportions do not perfectly match the 2D plan (minor shifts in where openings land on the walls).
Furniture arrangement is broadly consistent but not a perfect 1:1 match to the 2D symbols (notably the left bedroom bed configuration and some storage/cabinet elements).

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric rendering and largely faithful layout, with only minor opening and furniture-placement deviations from the 2D plan.
